meanings.definition: To commit oneself to and begin (an enterprise or responsibility)
meanings.sent1: I will undertake the project and start working on it tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She always undertakes new challenges with enthusiasm and determination.
meanings.sent3: John decided to undertake the task of organizing the event, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The team will undertake the mission to reach the mountain's summit before sunset.
meanings.sent5: Undertaking the role of team leader, Sarah led her group to victory in the competition.

meanings.sent1: He will undertake to deliver the package by noon.
meanings.sent2: The company undertakes to provide excellent customer service at all times.
meanings.sent3: The magician undertook to make the rabbit disappear in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: By signing the contract, she undertook to complete the work within the agreed timeframe.
meanings.sent5: Undertaking to keep the secret, she never revealed the surprise party plans.

meanings.definition: To take on a task or job
meanings.sent1: The company decided to undertake the construction of the new building.
meanings.sent2: She will undertake the responsibility of training the new employees.
meanings.sent3: The robot undertook the job of cleaning the entire house in record time.
meanings.sent4: The detective undertook the investigation of the mysterious case with great determination.
meanings.sent5: Undertaking the role of captain, he led the team to victory in the championship.
